nameEntry.part: St Joseph's Home for Children, Croydon

biogHist.abstract: St Joseph's Home, Croydon, run by the Sisters of St Joseph of the Sacred Heart, was established in 1925. It was intended for the care of boys and girls (including siblings) aged three to seven years who were defined as orphans, neglected and destitute. St Joseph's Home amalgamated with St Anthony's Croydon at the end of 1979 and the remaining children were moved into foster care in St Joseph's Cottages.
biogHist.p: St Joseph's Home, Croydon, run by the Sisters of St Joseph of the Sacred Heart, was established in 1926, in a fine house on Liverpool Road called 'Roslyn House'.

The house was a donation from Mr and Mrs Stuart Patterson, who bought it from Maurice J Savage and presented it to the Sisters of St Joseph in 1925. Initially, it accommodated 150 children. A new wing was added in 1927, a dormitory was added in 1945, and the building was renovated and further expanded between 1951 and 1953. In the years 1959-1963 the Home took in 356 children.

Children in St Joseph's were generally from single parent families, or households stricken by illness or disadvantage. Many children returned to their families, but some remained in the Home throughout their early childhood.

St Joseph's was founded specifically to keep siblings from the same family together, so took boys and girls. Ordinarily boys who reached the age of seven were sent on to Westmead Boys Home, while girls were sent to Lane Cove. However, siblings could be retained, finishing their schooling locally.

chronItem.event: Address - St Joseph's Home was situated at 34 Liverpool Road, Croydon

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Sisters of Saint Joseph of the Sacred Heart (1872 - )

descriptiveNote.p: The Sisters of Saint Joseph of the Sacred Heart ran St Joseph's Home for Children, Croydon.
Older boys were transferred from St Joseph's Home Croydon to St Vincent's Westmead
Older boys were transferred from St Joseph's Home Croydon to St Joseph's Kincumber

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Personal Record Cards (dates uncertain), St Joseph's Home for Children, Croydon (1925? - 1979?)
Notifications of Discharge (incomplete), St Joseph's Home, Croydon (1931 - 1979)
Notification of Reception (incomplete), St Joseph's Home for Children, Croydon (1928 - 1970)
Admission Registers, St Joseph's Home for Children, Croydon (1940 - 1969)

descriptiveNote.p: Older girls were transferred from St Joseph's Home Croydon to St Joseph's Home Lane Cove
From 1952 St Anthony's Home and St Joseph's Home for Children were both operated by the Sisters of St Joseph. St Anthony's Home absorbed St Joseph's Home for Children in 1979.
CatholicCare Adoption Services hold records of St Joseph's Home for Children, Croydon

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Archives of Mary MacKillop and the Sisters of St Joseph

descriptiveNote.p: The Archives of Mary MacKillop and the Sisters of St Joseph held and managed the records of St Joseph's Home for Children from 1979 to 2013. They were then transferred to CatholicCare Adoption Services, Bankstown.
St Joseph's Cottages were established to provide foster care for children who were still in care when St Joseph's Home for Children closed
